text: {p}HEADLINE: Another cold night ahead{/p}{p}LOW TODAY: 43{ } { } { } NORMAL LOW: 40{/p}{p}HIGH TODAY: 49{ } { } NORMAL HIGH: 58{/p}{p}What a buffet of weather conditions since late last night.{/p}{p}We had up to 8\" of snow in the Spring Mountains along with a dusting in the foothills.{/p}{p}Other than that, it was a good looking day with ample sunshine. But those northerly winds kept us in the 40s for the 3rd straight day. The last time Las Vegas failed to reach 50 degrees 3 days in a row was back in early January of 2022.{/p}{p}So far this season (since December 1st), Las Vegas has dropped below 40 degrees only 6 times compared to 18 times below 40 through January 11th of last year.{/p}{p}Don't put the winter jackets away just yet. Low temperatures tonight will drop down to near freezing once again.{/p}{p}Look for another chilly one tomorrow afternoon with highs around the 50 degree mark once again.{/p}{p}Pacific high pressure will build in just in time for the weekend resulting in warmer temperatures. Maybe a few spots close to 60 here this weekend and into early next week.{/p}{p}Even warmer conditions are expected by the end of next week with some highs in the mid 60s.{/p}{p}Not much chance for any rain or mountain snow through at least the end of next week.{/p}{p}CURRENT SNOWPACK: UPPER COLORADO RIVER BASIN - 75% (135% last year at this time){/p}{p}LAKE MEAD TRACKER: Lake mead is currently at 1069 feet compared to 1045 feet one year ago today.{/p}{p}Total valley rainfall in 2024: 0.04\" (-0.14\" below normal){/p}{p}Total valley rainfall through January 11th, 2023: 0.40\" (+0.20\" above normal){/p}{p}AIR QUALITY - HEALTHY{/p}{p}- Bill Bellis{/p}{p}{ } Proof of concept AI assistant.{/p}{p}In recent months, the Anti-Defamation League (ADL) {a href=\"https://www.adl.org/resources/press-release/us-antisemitic-incidents-skyrocketed-360-aftermath-attack-israel-according\" target=\"_blank\" title=\"https://www.adl.org/resources/press-release/us-antisemitic-incidents-skyrocketed-360-aftermath-attack-israel-according\"}has reported{/a} a significant increase in antisemitic incidents, including harassment, vandalism, and physical assaults, targeting the Jewish community.{ }{/p}{p}Data from the ADL reveals a shocking 361% increase in antisemitic incidents between Hamas’ attack in Israel on Oct. 7 and Jan. 7, compared to the same period the previous year.{ }{/p}{p}The total number of \"antisemitic events\" reached 3,283, surpassing the tally for any year in the last decade except for 2022 - however, the organization said it’s on track to outpace that year as well.{/p}{p}Approximately 40% (1,353) of the antisemitic incidents involved verbal or written harassment, while another 40% (1,317) were attributed to rallies featuring antisemitic rhetoric. Vandalism accounted for 553 events, while 60 incidents involved physical assaults.{/p}{p}{sd-embed class=\"sd-embedded-media\" data-alt=\"NATIONAL\" href=\"https://www.cair.com/press_releases/cair-received-staggering-2171-complaints-over-past-two-months-as-islamophobia-anti-palestinian-hate-spin-out-of-control/\" target=\"_blank\" help and reports of bias against Muslims and Palestinians between Oct. 7 and Dec. 2. This marks a 172% increase from the same period the previous year.{/p}{p}The majority, approximately 33.94%, were complaints about First Amendment violations of free speech, while 22.38% were related to employment issues.
